body_html:
@rafaelvalle

We have Hann, Hamming and Bartlett window functions available. Let us know if we forgot some important window functions.

By correction for windowing artifacts, do you mean that when used as a periodic window, the last value should be trimmed off?

Docs:
STFT: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.stft
Window fns: Hann, Hamming, Bartlett
body_text:
@rafaelvalle
We have Hann, Hamming and Bartlett window functions available. Let us know if we forgot some important window functions.
By correction for windowing artifacts, do you mean that when used as a periodic window, the last value should be trimmed off?
Docs:
STFT: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.stft
Window fns: Hann, Hamming, Bartlett
body:
@rafaelvalle 

We have Hann, Hamming and Bartlett window functions available. Let us know if we forgot some important window functions.

By correction for windowing artifacts, do you mean that when used as a periodic window, the last value should be trimmed off?

Docs:
STFT: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.stft
Window fns: [Hann](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.hann_window), [Hamming](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.hamming_window), [Bartlett](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.bartlett_window)
